title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Steps for adopting older packages to new development standards
text: Create last released tag Copy .github/workflows/pkgdown.yaml Fix URL DESCRIPTION, don’t forget trailing slash Tweak _pkgdown.yml Set source GitHub Pages branch

title: Steps for adopting older packages to new development standards
text: Use GitHub Actions Disable tic Disable Travis CI AppVeyor usethis::use_coverage() Consider open pull requests Tweak README use downlit::readme_document load_all() possible Update roxygen2 Use @examplesIf appropriate styler::style_pkg() Remove Collate: usethis::use_lifecycle_badge() usethis::use_lifecycle() Add pkgdown reference index Adapt tests testthat 3e Ensure dependency source files cycle-free, https://github.com/yonicd/foreman/issues/2 Ensure source files correspond test files via devtools::test_coverage_file() Import rlang appropriate Close open issues Deprecate functions moved somewhere else Avoid iris Synchronize downstream packages Add type documentation function arguments, ?::Check goodpractice::gp() Check spelling::update_wordlist(confirm = FALSE) Switch pkgdown dev mode “auto” Release CRAN

title: here
text: demonstration, article uses data analysis project lives /home/runner/work/_temp/Library//demo-project machine. project root. path likely different machine, package helps deal situation. project following structure: can review project GitHub also download copy. start working project RStudio, open demo-project.Rproj file. ensures working directory set /home/runner/work/_temp/Library//demo-project, project root. Opening .R .Rmd file may insufficient! development environments may different notion project. Either way, important working directory set project root subdirectory path. can check : (See vignette("rmarkdown") example working directory set subdirectory start.)
code: #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project #> ├── analysis #> │   └── report.Rmd #> ├── data #> │   └── penguins.csv #> ├── demo-project.Rproj #> └── prepare #>     └── penguins.R setwd(project_path) getwd() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project"

what: Declare the location of the current script
title: here
text: intended use add call ::i_am() beginning script first chunk rmarkdown report.1 achieves following: location current script report within project declared project root initialized, consistent location current script report informative message emitted.2 first argument ::i_am() path current file, relative project root. penguins.R script uses: ::i_am() displays top-level directory current project. project prepare/ directory root contains penguins.R, correctly inferred project root. ::i_am(), insert library() make () function available:3 top-level directory also returned () function: One important distinction working directory remains stable even working directory changed: (suggest steer clear ever changing working directory. may always feasible, particular working directory changed code control.)
code: here::i_am("prepare/penguins.R") #> here() starts at /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project library(here) here() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project" setwd("analysis") getwd() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project/analysis" here() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project" setwd("..")

title: here
text: can build path relative top-level directory order build full path file: works regardless associated source file lives inside project. (), path always relative top-level project directory. () works similarly file.path() fs::path(), can pass path components entire subpaths: seen , () returns absolute paths (starting /, <drive letter>:\ \\). makes safe pass paths functions, even working directory changed along way. version 1.0.0, absolute paths passed () returned unchanged. means can safely use absolute project-relative paths ().
code: here("data", "penguins.csv") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project/data/penguins.csv" readr::read_csv(   here("data", "penguins.csv"),   col_types = list(.default = readr::col_guess()),   n_max = 3 ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 8 #>   species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm #>   <chr>   <chr>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <dbl> #> 1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7               181 #> 2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186 #> 3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: body_mass_g <dbl>, sex <chr>, year <dbl> here("data/penguins.csv") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project/data/penguins.csv" data_path <- here("data") here(data_path) #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project/data" here(data_path, "penguins.csv") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project/data/penguins.csv"

title: here
text: dr_here() function explains reasoning behind choosing project root: show_reason argument can set FALSE reduce output one line:
code: dr_here() #> here() starts at /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project. #> - This directory contains a file 'prepare/penguins.R' #> - Initial working directory: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project #> - Current working directory: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project dr_here(show_reason = FALSE) #> here() starts at /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project

what: What if the working directory is wrong?
title: here
text: declaration active file via ::i_am() also protects accidentally running script working directory outside project. example calls ::i_am() temporary directory, clearly outside project: can also happen file renamed moved without updating ::i_am() call. future, helper function assist installing updating suitably formatted ::i_am() calls scripts reports.
code: withr::with_dir(tempdir(), {   print(getwd())   here::i_am("prepare/penguins.R") }) #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpptAXLi" #> Error: Could not find associated project in working directory or any parent directory. #> - Path in project: prepare/penguins.R #> - Current working directory: /tmp/RtmpptAXLi #> Please open the project associated with this file and try again.

title: here
text: packages also export () function. Loading packages loading masks () function: One way work around problem use ::(): conflicted package offers alternative: detects () exported one package allows use neither indicate preference.
code: library(plyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'plyr' #> The following object is masked from 'package:here': #>  #>     here here() #> Error in here(): argument "f" is missing, with no default here::here() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project" library(conflicted) here() #> Error: #> ! [conflicted] here found in 2 packages. #> Either pick the one you want with `::`: #> • plyr::here #> • here::here #> Or declare a preference with `conflicts_prefer()`: #> • `conflicts_prefer(plyr::here)` #> • `conflicts_prefer(here::here)`  conflicted::conflict_prefer("here", "here") #> [conflicted] Will prefer here::here over #> any other package. here() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project"

title: here
text: eliminate potential confusion, ::i_am() accepts uuid argument. idea script report calls ::i_am() early (first 100 lines) universally unique identifier. Even file location reused across projects (e.g. two projects contain “prepare/data.R” file), files can identified correctly uuid argument ::i_am() call different. uuid argument passed ::i_am(): project root contains file specified file path searched first 100 lines file read correct file, ::i_am() call passes uuid among 100 lines, matched wrong file, uuid found text Use uuid::UUIDgenerate() create universally unique identifiers: Ensure uuid arguments actually unique across files! future, helper function assist installing updating suitably formatted ::i_am() calls scripts reports.
code: uuid::UUIDgenerate() #> [1] "aa5f9f35-ff3a-4877-8596-9f431b9583ea"

title: here
text: advisable start fresh R session often possible, especially focusing another project. still may legitimate cases desirable reset project root. start, let’s create temporary project demonstration: script.R file contains call ::i_am() declare location. Running current working directory fail: reset project root mid-session, change working directory setwd(). Now, subsequent call ::i_am() within script.R works: reiterate: fresh session almost always better, cleaner, safer, robust solution. Use approach last resort.
code: temp_project_path <- tempfile() dir.create(temp_project_path) scripts_path <- file.path(temp_project_path, "scripts") dir.create(scripts_path) script_path <- file.path(scripts_path, "script.R") writeLines(   c(     'here::i_am("scripts/script.R")',     'print("Hello, world!")'   ),   script_path ) fs::dir_tree(temp_project_path) #> /tmp/RtmpptAXLi/file2f9256d961b9 #> └── scripts #>     └── script.R writeLines(readLines(script_path)) #> here::i_am("scripts/script.R") #> print("Hello, world!") source(script_path, echo = TRUE) #>  #> > here::i_am("scripts/script.R") #> Error: Could not find associated project in working directory or any parent directory. #> - Path in project: scripts/script.R #> - Current working directory: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project #> Please open the project associated with this file and try again. setwd(temp_project_path) source(script_path, echo = TRUE) #>  #> > here::i_am("scripts/script.R") #> here() starts at /tmp/RtmpptAXLi/file2f9256d961b9 #>  #> > print("Hello, world!") #> [1] "Hello, world!"

title: here
text: package simple restricted interface, design. underlying logic provided much powerful rprojroot package. default behavior suit workflow one reason another, rprojroot package may better alternative. also recommended import rprojroot packages. following example shows find RStudio project starting directory: Arbitrary criteria can defined. See vignette("rprojroot", package = "rprojroot") introduction.
code: library(rprojroot) find_root(is_rstudio_project, file.path(project_path, "analysis")) #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/here/demo-project"

text: render report.Rmd, ensure path penguins.csv relative analysis/ directory - .e., ../data/penguins.csv. chunks knit properly, run console since working directory console isn’t analysis/. package circumvents issue always referring project root: files accessed report.Rmd referred using (): ensures penguins.csv can read report knit code run interactively console.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Müller K (2025). : Simpler Way Find Files. R package version 1.0.2, https://.r-lib.org/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {here: A Simpler Way to Find Your Files},   author = {Kirill Müller},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.2},   url = {https://here.r-lib.org/}, }

what: A Simpler Way to Find Your Files
title: A Simpler Way to Find Your Files
text: goal package enable easy file referencing project-oriented workflows. contrast using setwd(), fragile dependent way organize files, uses top-level directory project easily build paths files.

title: A Simpler Way to Find Your Files
text: Install released version CRAN:
code: install.packages("here")

title: A Simpler Way to Find Your Files
text: package creates paths relative top-level directory. package displays top-level current project load time call (): can build path relative top-level directory order read write file: relative paths work regardless associated source file lives inside project, like analysis projects data reports different subdirectories. See included demo project example. Illustration Allison Horst
code: here::i_am("README.Rmd") #> here() starts at /Users/kirill/git/R/r-lib/here here() #> [1] "/Users/kirill/git/R/r-lib/here" here("inst", "demo-project", "data", "penguins.csv") #> [1] "/Users/kirill/git/R/r-lib/here/inst/demo-project/data/penguins.csv" readr::write_csv(palmerpenguins::penguins, here("inst", "demo-project", "data", "penguins.csv"))

title: Find your files — here
text: () uses reasonable heuristics find project's files, based current working directory time package loaded. Use drop-replacement file.path(), always locate files relative project root.

code: here(...)

text: ... [character] Path components project root, can empty. argument string containing one path components separated forward slash "/".

text: package intended interactive use . Use rprojroot::has_file() functions rprojroot package control, package development. () raises error otherwise behaves unexpectedly, may attached plyr another package . Correct using conflicted package, use ::("data", "df.rda").

title: Find your files — here
text: project root established call ::i_am(). Although recommended, can changed calling ::i_am() . absence call (e.g. new project), starting current working directory package load time, directory hierarchy walked upwards directory least one following conditions found: contains file .contains file matching [.]Rproj$ contents matching ^Version:  first line contains file .vscode/settings.json contains file _quarto.yml contains file renv.lock contents matching "Packages":\s*\{ contains file DESCRIPTION contents matching ^Package: contains file remake.yml contains file .projectile contains directory .git contains file .git contents matching ^gitdir: contains directory .svn either case, () appends arguments path components root directory.

what: Declare location of current script or report — i_am
title: Declare location of current script or report — i_am
text: Add call ::i_am("<project-relative path>.<ext>") top R script first chunk rmarkdown document. ensures project root set correctly: subsequent calls () refer implied project root. current working directory outside project script report intended run, fail descriptive message.

title: Declare location of current script or report — i_am
code: i_am(path, ..., uuid = NULL)

title: Declare location of current script or report — i_am
text: path [character(1)] path current script report, relative project root. Passing absolute path raises error. ... Must empty, reserved future use. uuid [character(1)] NULL, unique string matched first 100 lines file. Use uuid::UUIDgenerate() create unique string can used uuid argument.

title: Declare location of current script or report — i_am
text: function called side effects.

title: Declare location of current script or report — i_am
text: Relying project root determined project file, default versions prior 1.0.0, weakly protects running script arbitrary directory outside intended project. i_am() function offers stronger way define project root: ensure project root actually contains file location, optionally checking file contents uniquely identify file via nonce argument. function fail script report moved within project. Update i_am() call reflect new location. use nonce argument extra safety, sure change save existing script report new name.

title: Declare location of current script or report — i_am
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ here::i_am("prepare/penguins.R") here::i_am("analysis/report.Rmd", uuid = "f9e884084b84794d762a535f3facec85") } # }

code: set_here(path = ".", verbose = TRUE)

title: Add a marker file to a project — set_here
text: path [character(1)] Directory create .file, defaults current directory. verbose [logical(1)] Verbose output, defaults TRUE.

title: Add a marker file to a project — set_here
text: set_here() creates empty file named ., default current directory. encounters file, uses directory contains file root. useful none default criteria apply. need restart R session () picks newly created file.

title: here 1.0.2 (2025-09-14)
text: Discover VS Code, Quarto renv projects (#128, #130).

title: here 1.0.2 (2025-09-14)
text: Auto-update GitHub Actions (#145). Auto-update GitHub Actions. Run: https://github.com/r-lib//actions/runs/14636203620 Run: https://github.com/r-lib//actions/runs/10425486329 Run: https://github.com/r-lib//actions/runs/10200110394 Run: https://github.com/r-lib//actions/runs/9728440182 Run: https://github.com/r-lib//actions/runs/9691616332 Add Aviator configuration. Change maintainer e-mail.

title: here 1.0.2 (2025-09-14)
text: Use reviewdog external PRs (#147). Cleanup fix macOS (#136). Format air, check detritus, better handling extra-packages (#133). Enhance permissions workflow (#124). Permissions, better tests missing suggests, lints (#123). fail covr builds token given (#122). Always use _R_CHECK_FORCE_SUGGESTS_=false (#121). Correct installation xml2 (#120). Explain (#119). Add xml2 covr, print testthat results (#118). Fix (#117). Sync (#116). Avoid failure fledge workflow changes (#114). Fetch tags fledge workflow avoid unnecessary NEWS entries (#113). Use stable pak (#112). Latest changes (#111). Trigger run (#110). Use pkgdown branch (#109). ci: Use pkgdown branch ci: Updates duckdb ci: Trigger run Install via R CMD INSTALL ., pak (#108). ci: Install via R CMD INSTALL ., pak ci: Bump version upload-artifact action Install local package pkgdown builds. Improve support protected branches fledge. Improve support protected branches, without fledge. Sync latest developments. Use v2 instead master. Import actions-sync, check carefully.

title: here 1.0.2 (2025-09-14)
text: Fix link “forgot” chapter (@Masterxilo, #101). Fixed “heuristics” typo (@t-gummer, #91).

title: here 1.0.2 (2025-09-14)
text: Merge branch ‘docs’. Internal changes . Merge pull request #103 jack-davison/patch-1. fix broken link .Rmd vignette Merge cran-1.0.1. Adapt testthat 3.0.1.

title: here 1.0.1 (2020-12-13)
text: CRAN release: 2020-12-13 Adapt testthat 3.0.1.

title: here 1.0.0 (2020-11-15)
text: CRAN release: 2020-11-15

title: here 1.0.0 (2020-11-15)
text: New ::i_am() offers new recommended way declare project root. Instead relying special files directories indicate project root, script report now can declare location relative project root (#27). dr_here() shows initial current working directory (#18, #55).

title: here 1.0.0 (2020-11-15)
text: Improve readme add “Getting started” vignette (#44, @sharlagelfand). Extend “Getting started” vignette detailed description behavior use cases (#55). Update ?address conflict lubridate::() (#37, @nzgwynn). New “rmarkdown” vignette (#55). set_here() superseded favor ::i_am() (#61). explicit documentation ... argument () (#7).

title: here 1.0.0 (2020-11-15)
text: Add testthat tests (#57). Use GitHub Actions checks (#52). Requires rprojroot >= 2.0.1. Re-license MIT (#50). Added Jennifer Bryan contributor (#32).

title: here 0.1 (2017-01-25)
text: CRAN release: 2017-05-28 Initial CRAN release. Uses fixed root contains .file can either RStudio project, R package, remake project, Projectile project, VCS repository. root established package loading time, shown message. current working directory used fallback. set_here() function creates .file directory recognized root (). dr_here() function explains reasoning () current session.
